lemma: Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love
context1: Triune love represents the highest form of love, the sublimely perfect love that exists irrespective of our circumstances. This love is the essence of God's nature as described in 1 John 4:8, Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love. By understanding and accepting the Lord's love, we can move towards healing and wholeness. We are not merely being loved by an external entity but are being invited into the communion of the very Triune life and love of the Triune God.
context2: "Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love." "Loving" is not merely an activity of God, nor is love an attribute, per se, but God IS love. The human capacity to love is a gift from God. Without God, love cannot be defined or even exist. God is love.

context2: God is love, you don't know God, and you believe Love is harmful, i.e. you don't know what love is. Sad. "Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love."
